intro: Agnesia bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia agnesia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
